intro: Tristemma angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved tristema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Tristemma angustifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
